(OOC: I'm sorry I haven't posted in a while. Well, this is a 
continuation of sorts to my last post^_^)

The sun had reached its pinnacle hours ago, and thus had begun to set 
only moments before. The winds had long since died down, leaving an 
eerie silence in their place. The creatures that roamed the plains 
upon which the Cybertron Fire had landed seemed non-existant. Nothing 
stirred. Then, as if driven by an unseen force Tavatron ran across the 
barren plain, her organic skin dotted with sweat and her breath coming 
in short, controlled gasps. Suddenly everything seemed to stop as she 
lept into the air and swung her staff around, cleanly slicing through 
the thin cranch of a young sapling. Then, in one fluid motion she 
barely let her feet touch the ground as she once again jumped, this 
time swinging her hips and legs around in order to hit the sapling 
with a back-kick. The small tree's upper half flew across the tall 
grass, coming to rest a few yards from its previous position. 

The tall grass began a slow, rythmic dance in time to the blowing of 
the wind.The sun had nearly set, but time seemed irrelevant as 
Tavatron continued to spar with an invisible enemy. She threw multiple 
hook-kicks, spinning butterfly kicks, and roundhouses to various parts 
of the body. The shots were intermixed with carefully placed blocks 
and punches coupled with slides to the left and right. The tempo of 
the unheard melody increased as the waving of the grass grew more 
erratic. The silence was occasionally broken by the sound of loud 
'Kiaps' and 'Ices' whenever the battling wolf 'bot landed a solid kick 
or reverse punch. 

Tavatron spun once more, her feet perfectly placed as she lifted her 
back leg and swung it around for a finally blow to her opponent's 
head. Suddenly the waving of the long prairie stopped. The sun had set 
and a cold white moon now shone high in the sky. Tavatron's only foot 
remaining on the ground suddenly slipped out from under her. She fell 
hard on her back, her tail crushed between a rock and a very hard 
'bot.

Normally she would have cried out and cussed at herself for being 
foolish enough to fall, but no, not this time. Tavatron simply resumed 
a fighting stance, ignoring the throbbing of her backside and exposed 
shoulder. Before she could begin sparring anew the long, mournful howl 
of a wolf broke the growing silence. It was a death cry, one of the 
packmates had fallen. Tavatron sighed as she raised her muzzle 
skyward, her own mournful howl joining in the wolf chorus. The cries 
faded out until only Tavatron's plantive wail remained. Only this time 
she wasn't crying for a fallen packmate, but for the possibility of a 
fallen friend. No one had brought her any news of Dinobot's condition, 
and she had refused to go back inside after the cowardly way she had 
acted.

Tavatron crouched on the ground, the cool wind a comfort against her 
overheated synthetic skin. Another drawback of her enhancements. Her 
breath was short but controlled and her mouth partially opened as she 
continued to pant. Whenever something arose that she couldn't handle 
Tavatron would spar. Whether it be alone or with... a... companion...

Tavatron growled, the memory of her practice battle with Dinobot 
making itself known once more. She had enjoyed battling with such a 
talented warrior, she wondered if they would ever get the chance to 
spar again. He had nearly beaten-- 

Well, it had been more of a draw. Neither of them had been a clear 
winner, something that had never happend to her before. The wind died 
down once more as Tavatron stood and slowly made her way back to the 
Cybertronian Fire. The ship loomed in the distance, a dark shadow on 
an even darker horizon. 

The solemn wolf 'bot pushed open the massive door and walked inside, 
her claws gently clicking against the floor. The hallway seemed longer 
than usual as she once again followed the arrows down the corridor and 
toward the CR room. The scene of Dinobot collapsing and her standing 
there, doing nothing, played before her weary eyes. Tavatron rubbed 
them gently, the hours of practice had taken a lot out of her already 
tired form. Now she was merely exhausted. It was a wonder she could 
stand at all. 

Tavatron stopped at the entrance to the CR room. Her skin was cold and 
clamy with sweat, adding to her discomfort. Dinobot lay before her 
atop the same metal slab her had before. Tubes connected to various 
instruments ran down his throat. This was no state for a warrior such 
as Dinobot. He should be out there, battling. Tavatron kept her gaze 
averted as she pulled up a chair and sat beside him. If worse came to 
worse she wanted to remember him as he was, not like this. 

She was surprisingly calm despite all that had happened. Tavatron drew 
her knees close to her chest and wrapped her arms around them. As far 
as she was concerned, Tavatron wasn't moving until Dinobot either 
stopped breathing or got up and yelled at her for not repairing her 
missing shoulder plate yet. The thought of him arguing with her over a 
piece or armor brought a slight smile to her lips. With that thought 
on her mind Tavatron rested her head atop her crossed arms and 
continued to watch the slow rise and fall of Dinobot's chest.
